TI_DOC.P: EBGU - Håndtering af fast affald i Kurgan Tyube (TJ-Kurgan-Tyube City)

STI_DOC.P: Update to GPN published on EBRD.COM ref: 7960-GPN-43754 (30.7.2015)
GENERAL PROCUREMENT NOTICE

CONTENTS.P: Project name: Kurgan Tyube Solid Waste Management
Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure

Subsidiary State Unitary Enterprise “Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali” (“KMK”) in Kurgan-Tyube City intends to use the proceeds of loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) and EBRD SSF grant to improve solid waste management services in Kurgan-Tyube city. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of 4 000 000 USD equivalent, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— rehabilitation of waste collection points and operation centre,
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the first quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Subsidiary State Unitary Enterprise Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali

Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure

Subsidiary State Unitary Enterprise “Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali” (“KMK”) in Kurgan-Tyube City intends to use the proceeds of loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) and EBRD SSF grant to improve solid waste management services in Kurgan-Tyube city. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of 4 000 000 USD equivalent, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— rehabilitation of waste collection points and operation centre,
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the first quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser's country.
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Subsidiary State Unitary Enterprise Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali
